Comment 1: 
"When the input is broken into tokens, a semicolon is automatically inserted into the
token stream at the end of a non-blank line if the line's final token is ... )"
http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#Semicolons

"You should never put the opening brace of a control structure (if, for, switch, or
select) on the next line. If you do, a semicolon will be inserted before the brace,
which could cause unwanted effects."
http://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html#semicolons

If you run gofmt on your code, you will see the problem.
if returnFalse(); {
	println("inside-if statement case1.")
	x++
}
http://golang.org/doc/go_spec.html#If_statements
